title:
Symmetry Transformations in Cosmological and Black Hole Analytical
  Solutions
authors: Edgar A. Le\'on and Andr\'es Sandoval-Rodr\'iguez
abstract:
We analyze the transformation of a very broad class of metrics that can be
expressed in terms of static coordinates. Starting from a general ansatz, we
obtain a relation for the parameters in which one can impose further symmetries
or restrictions. One of the simplest restrictions leads to FLRW cases, while
transforming from the initial static to other static-type coordinates can lead
to near horizon coordinates, Wheeler--Regge, and isotropic coordinates, among
others. As less restrictive cases, we show an indirect route for obtaining
Kruskal-Szekeres within this approach, as well as Lema\^{\i}tre coordinates. We
use Schwarzschild spacetime as a prototype for testing the procedure in
individual cases. However, application to other spacetimes, such as de-Sitter,
Reissner-Nordstr\"{o}m, and Schwarzschild de Sitter, can be readily
generalized.
